answers.A: SELECT name, salary FROM employees WHERE salary > 50000;

questionDown: How do you select the first 5 rows from a table named orders sorted in descending order by the order_date column?

answers.A: SELECT * FROM orders ORDER BY order_date DESC LIMIT 5;

answers.B: SELECT TOP 5 * FROM orders ORDER BY order_date DESC;

answers.C: SELECT FIRST 5 * FROM orders ORDER BY order_date DESC;

answers.D: SELECT * FROM orders WHERE ROWNUM <= 5 ORDER BY order_date DESC;

answers.E: LIMIT 5 SELECT * FROM orders ORDER BY order_date DESC;

questionDown: How do you select the columns product_id and the count of orders for each product from a table named order_details grouped by product_id?

answers.A: SELECT product_id, COUNT(*) FROM order_details GROUP BY product_id;

answers.B: SELECT product_id, TOTAL(orders) FROM order_details GROUP BY product_id;

answers.C: PULL product_id, COUNT(*) FROM order_details GROUP BY product_id;

answers.D: GET product_id, COUNT(*) FROM order_details GROUP BY product_id;

answers.E: SHOW product_id, COUNT(*) FROM order_details GROUP BY product_id;

questionDown: How do you select the columns customer_id and the total revenue for each customer from a table named orders joined with a table named order_details?

answers.A: SELECT customer_id, SUM(total_price) FROM orders INNER JOIN order_details ON orders.order_id = order_details.order_id GROUP BY customer_id;

answers.B: SELECT customer_id, TOTAL(total_price) FROM orders JOIN order_details ON orders.order_id = order_details.order_id GROUP BY customer_id;

answers.C: PULL customer_id, SUM(total_price) FROM orders JOIN order_details ON orders.order_id = order_details.order_id GROUP BY customer_id;

answers.D: GET customer_id, SUM(total_price) FROM orders INNER JOIN order_details ON orders.order_id = order_details.order_id GROUP BY customer_id;

answers.E: SHOW customer_id, TOTAL(total_price) FROM orders JOIN order_details ON orders.order_id = order_details.order_id GROUP BY customer_id;

questionDown: How do you select the columns employee_id and the average salary for each department from a table named employees grouped by department_id?

answers.A: SELECT employee_id, AVG(salary) FROM employees GROUP BY department_id;

answers.B: SELECT employee_id, AVERAGE(salary) FROM employees GROUP BY department_id;

answers.C: PULL employee_id, AVG(salary) FROM employees GROUP BY department_id;

answers.D: GET employee_id, AVG(salary) FROM employees GROUP BY department_id;

answers.E: SHOW employee_id, AVERAGE(salary) FROM employees GROUP BY department_id;

questionDown: How do you select the columns product_id, category, and the maximum price for each category from a table named products?

answers.A: SELECT product_id, category, MAX(price) FROM products GROUP BY category;

answers.B: SELECT product_id, category, MAXIMUM(price) FROM products GROUP BY category;

answers.C: PULL product_id, category, MAX(price) FROM products GROUP BY category;

answers.D: GET product_id, category, MAX(price) FROM products GROUP BY category;

answers.E: SHOW product_id, category, MAXIMUM(price) FROM products GROUP BY category;

questionDown: How do you select all columns from a table named students where the age is between 18 and 25?

answers.A: SELECT * FROM students WHERE age BETWEEN 18 AND 25;

answers.B: SELECT ALL FROM students WHERE age BETWEEN 18 AND 25;

answers.C: GET * FROM students WHERE age BETWEEN 18 AND 25;

answers.D: PULL * FROM students WHERE age BETWEEN 18 AND 25;

answers.E: SHOW * FROM students WHERE age BETWEEN 18 AND 25;

questionDown: How do you select the columns customer_id and order_date from a table named orders where the order_date is in the year 2022?

answers.E:
for row, element in matrix: 
 print(row, element)
